TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AuditLevel extends System.Enum

remarks.para: When creating a indigo1 application that requires authentication and/or authorization of the callers, you can specify that events related to security be recorded for either success, failure, or both. The level of auditing is determined by this enumeration.
The location of the audit log is specified by setting the property of the class to one of the values.
For more information about auditing, see Auditing Security Events.
You can also specify audit behavior using the serviceSecurityAudit element binding.

summary.para: Specifies when to audit security events.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel Failure = int32(2)

summary.para: Only failed security-related events will be recorded.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel None = int32(0)

summary.para: No events will be recorded. This is the default.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel Success = int32(1)

summary.para: Only successful security-related events will be recorded.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel SuccessOrFailure = int32(3)

summary.para: Both failed and successful security-related events will be recorded.
